intro: Ceropegia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening in regions with warm climates.
